== Economy ==
Benguela was one of the centres of Portuguese trade to the African interior. The city remains an important commercial link between western and eastern Angola. Coffee
column5: and tobacco are grown in the interior regions of Angola and widely traded in Benguela.

column1: Manganese from the interior is also traded in Benguela. Industries local to the city include fish processing and the milling of sugarcane; the city also produces pottery
column3: and tools.Foreign trade is handled through the deep-water port of Lobito
column4: which is located 29 kilometres (18 mi) north of Benguela. Lobito
column5: once the busiest port in Angola
column6: was severely disrupted during the Angolan Civil War. The port has since revived and supports trade in the Benguela region.
